thermotropic and lyotropic liquid crystals. Structures, defects, and textures of phases with orientational and
partial translational order. Dynamics of phase transitions.

(Cross-listed with CPHY 72242) Basic techniques in characterization using X-ray scattering, neutron scattering,
light scattering, NMR, optical microscopy, scanning electron microscopy, transmission electron and tunneling
electron microscopy and ellipsometry. Laboratory measurements, error analysis, cell fabrication.

optical properties except the nature of their phase transitions. Also discussed is their interactions with
surfaces and the structural defects that they can form.

optics of liquid crystals; optomechancial effects in liquid crystal elastomers.

Course Name: LABVIEW FOR DATA ACQUISITION AND INSTRUMENT CONTROL
Description:
(Cross-listed with CPHY 72249) Introduction to laboratory data acquisition and instrument control using
LabView Software.

Course Name: ADVANCED LIQUID CRYSTALLINE AND POLYMERIC MATERIALS
Description:
(Cross-listed with CPHY 72335) Liquid crystals and polymers are soft matters of two important disciplines of
science and technology. They both have a similar history and are rich in physical and optical properties useful
for fundamental and applied research. This course introduce students to recent advances in liquid crystals and
polymers with emphasis on structure-property relationships, physical and optical properties, and their
applications.

Course Name: LIQUID CRYSTAL, POLYMER AND COLLOID COMPOSITES
Description:
(Cross-listed with CPHY 72640) Interdisciplinary science of systems consisting of liquid crystal, polymer and
colloid. Statistical physics of composite systems, mixing free energy, phase separation principle, phase
diagrams and phase separation dynamics. States, structures and free energies of liquid crystal, polymer and
colloidal systems. Polymer dispersed liquid crystals (PDLCs), polymer stabilized liquid crystals (PSCTs) and
their applications. Laboratory experiments on composite systems and fabrication of PDLC and PSCT light
shutters.

(Cross-listed with CPHY 72643) Apply knowledge of liquid crystals and optics to the design of liquid crystal
electro-optical devices. Emphasis is on modeling of devices and the use of that modeling to optimize device
characteristics. Several particular device designs are considered to familiarize the student with the state of the
art in liquid crystal displays and other electro-optical applications of liquid crystals and to prepare them to
advance the art in future designs.

(Cross-listed with CPHY 72647) The basics of fluids having internal structures, such as long range orientational
order andor one and two dimensional positional order. Materials include thermotropic smetic, lamellar lyotropic
and columnar liquid crystals, soap films, fluid foams, fluid fibers and Langmuir monolayers.

(Cross-listed with CPHY 72650) Materials modeling at the classical (i.e. non-quantum) level. Monte Carlo
methods; molecular dynamics simulation; mesoscale models; numerical methods; case studies.

(Cross-listed with CPHY 72651) This interdisciplinary course presents the concepts, principles and the state-of-
the-arts of nanotechnologies and their applications in biological and biomedical science and engineering. Focus
is on the fundamental physical principles and engineering technologies of device miniaturization and system
integration for bioapplications.
